newsitem.title: INDIA: Paribas upgrades India's TELCO to "buy".
newsitem.headline: Paribas upgrades India's TELCO to "buy".

text.p: Paribas Capital Markets said it was upgrading shares of India's leading truck maker Tata Engineering and Locomotive Company (TELCO) to "buy" from "no action."

"Since our last report on the company last week, the local stock has fallen 8.0 percent, the GDR has fallen 34 percent, while the market has only fallen 5.0 percent," Paribas Capital Markets said in a research report released on Tuesday.
The share had fallen far below its traditional premium to the automobile sector and was probably unjustified in the light of the company's continuing earnings growth, it said.

"We think that the recent fall in TELCO locals and GDRs has been driven by speculative rumours about a supposed slowdown in light commercial vehicle sales and inventory build up - something that does not add up from the volume sales sigures."
It said the fall in prices of local shares as well as GDRs created a buying opportunity which investors should take advantage of.
TELCO shares were trading at 398.75 rupees on the Bombay Stock Exchange on Tuesday, down 9.25 rupees from the previous close.
